Job Title: Procurement Supervisor - Remote

Location: Providence, RI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
Job Overview:

The Procurement Supervisor is responsible for leading and managing their team to meet department strategic goals. Supervisors have direct oversight for Procurement processes, analytics, promotions, purchase order revisions and resolutions, and expedition. This position will address supplier escalations and ensure compliance of Procurement policies and processes. Additional responsibilities will include defining best demonstrated practices and standardizing processes.

Job Responsibilities:

 Oversees daily activities of team by monitoring service levels and help execute against department goals. Collaborates with cross-functional stakeholders including Procurement leadership to drive results and address escalations with customers through research, analytics and solutions. Applies critical thinking and business acumen to identify and solve escalations. Ensures the effective performance of the assigned Procurement functions. Addresses and reviews service level reporting to provide guidance, coaching, suggestions, etc. Ensures all Procurement processes are followed, errors or discrepancies are promptly reviewed and resolved. Supports, implements and trains team on business strategic initiatives including standard operating procedures. Establishes and maintains effective communication and coordination with company personnel, direct reports, and management. Participates in personnel decision making including hiring, onboarding, training and performance management. Develops associate career path and continuous training and education, coaching, mentoring. Provides leadership through effective goal setting, delegation, and communication. Ensures personnel are complying with department policies and procedures. Partners with management to address opportunities with a sense of urgency. Develops, streamlines and implements processes and procedures to meet evolving business needs in collaboration with all cross-functional business stakeholders. Provides subject matter expertise in department and enterprise-wide projects to meet strategic initiatives. Performs other job duties as assigned.

Job Requirements:

Education/ Certifications: (Required & Preferred)

 Bachelor’s degree in business, materials management, operations management, engineering or related field preferred

Experience:

 At least 3-5 years of procurement and/or supply chain experience Experience working with suppliers and/or customers Supervisory experience preferred System Implementation Preferred

Knowledge:

 High competency level in MS Office applications Knowledge of purchasing and supply chain systems Strong understanding of Procurement, Logistics and inventory management practices Understanding of purchasing policies and procedures

Skills/ Abilities:

 Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills Strong trouble-shooting and problem-solving abilities Ability to lead, train and supervise others Relationship management skills Excellent analytical skills Experience in taking initiative and making appropriate, timely decisions. Strong organizational and planning skills Some travel may be required

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. UNFI is an Equal Opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive and respectful environment for all. - M/F/Veteran/Disability. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
